page.title: 18SCHOOL HISTORY STROUD
page.content: {Old and New School,Kingscourt. There has been a school at Kingscourt,Stroud since 1837.It was originally built as a church school for local Non-Conformist families. The old school closed in l970, but many people remember their days there with pleasure. Several old pupils remember back to the time around World War l. For some this was their only experience of school life.Teachers were liked and respected but very strict.No-one talked in lessons and the cane was often used.Water was often brought from a spring and heating by a coke stove.Children hauled library books up from the station on a hand cart.On May Day children decked gates with leaves to greet the teachers.The new larger school called Gastrells was built close by.It has l40 pupils.
